META.description: Texas is the state with the most active execution chamber by far. Use this interactive to search through the inmates living on death row by the length of their stay, race, age and sex.
META.email_line: Check out the Texas Tribune's interactive feature: Faces of Death Row, a data-driven approach to one of Texas' most controversial policies.
META.shareline: A data-driven approach to one of Texas' most controversial policies.

INMATES.summary: Acker was convicted in the kidnapping and murder of a 32-year-old female.
Allen was convicted in the stabbing deaths of his ex-girlfriend and her daughter.
Allen was convicted in the sexual assault and murder of a 2-year-old female.
Alvarez was convicted for his participation in two drive-by shootings.
Andrus was convicted in the shooting deaths of a woman and a man in a Kroger parking lot.
Aranda was convicted in the shooting death of an undercover officer during a drug bust in Laredo.
Armstrong was convicted in the murder of a man with a box cutter during a robbery.
Austin was convicted in the murder of a 9-year-old boy.
Avila was convicted in the beating death of a child in El Paso.
Ayestas was convicted in the strangling death of a woman whose home he was burglarizing.
Balderas was convicted in a gang-related shooting.
Balentine was convicted in the shooting deaths of three male teenagers.
Barbee was convicted in the murders of his pregnant ex-girlfriend and her 7-year-old boy.
Bartee was convicted in the murder of a 37-year-old male.
Batiste was convicted in the shooting death of a man during a carjacking.
Battaglia was convicted in the shooting deaths of his two daughters, ages 6 and 9.
Beatty was convicted in the strangling death of his mother, 62, during a burglary of a habitation.
Bess was convicted in the murder and sexual assault of a 20-year-old woman.
Bible was convicted in the sexual assault and murder of a woman who came to his residence to use the phone.
Bigby was convicted in the murders of a 26-year-old man and his infant son.
Braziel was convicted in the shooting death of a man and the sexual assault of the man's wife.
Brewer was convicted in the robbery and stabbing death of a 66-year-old man.
Bridgers was convicted in the shooting death and robbery of a 53-year-old female.
Broadnax was convicted in the shooting death of a man during a robbery.
Brown was convicted in the shooting death of his ex-wife while she was in her car with their two children.
Brown was convicted in the execution-style slaying of four people in a Houston residence.
Broxton was convicted in the robbery and murder of Sheila Dockens of Louisiana.
Buck was convicted in the shooting deaths of his ex-girlfriend Debra Gardner and another person in Houston.

Burton was convicted in the strangling death of a female whom he confronted while she was jogging through her neighborhood.
Busby was convicted in the abduction and murder of a 78-year-old woman.
Butler was convicted in the shooting death of a 50-year-old woman during the robbery of a cleaner's store.
Cade was convicted in the stabbing deaths of his girlfriend and her daughter.
Calvert was convicted in the murder of his ex-wife. After the murder, Calvert kidnapped his four-year-old son and fled the state.
Campbell was convicted in the abduction and murder of Alexandra Rendon in Houston.
Canales was convicted in the strangling death of a 47-year-old offender in a prison cell.
Cantu was convicted of fatally shooting his 27-year-old cousin.
Cardenas was convicted in the murder of a 16-year-old girl in Edinburg.
Cargill was convicted in the murder of a woman who was set to testify against her in a child protective case.
Carpenter was convicted in the murder a 52-year-old woman during a burglary.
Carter was convicted in the murder of an 89-year-old man during a robbery.
Carty was convicted in the abduction and murder of a 25-year-old woman.
Castillo and three co-defendants were convicted in the fatal shooting of a 19-year-old male after demanding his money.
Cathey was convicted in the abduction and murder of Christina Castillo in Houston.
Chanthakoummane was convicted in the stabbing death of a woman.
Clark was convicted in the drowning death of a 20-year-old female.
Coble was convicted in the shooting deaths of his wife's parents and brother.
Cole was convicted in the shooting deaths of his wife and 15-year-old step-daughter.
Cortez was convicted of participating in the shooting deaths of four people.
Crutsinger was convicted in the stabbing deaths of a mother and daughter, ages 71 and 89.
Cruz-Garcia was convicted in the murder of a 7-year-old.
Cubas was convicted in the kidnapping, sexual assault and fatal shooting of a 15-year-old female.
Cummings and co-defendant Albert Love Jr. were convicted in the murders of two men sitting in a vehicle.
Curry was convicted in the shooting death of a Popeyeâ€™s Restaurant employee during a robbery.
Daniel was convicted in the shooting death of an Austin police officer at a Walmart.
Davila was convicted in the shooting deaths of a 5-year-old girl and her grandmother at a birthday party.
Davis was convicted in the murder of a 16-year-old girl who had accused him of rape.
Davis was convicted in the murder of a 16-year-old female he followed from a party in El Paso.
Davis was convicted in the murder of 31-year-old Michael Alan Foster, an intellectually disabled man, at his Humble apartment.
Dennes was convicted in the murder of a man during a robbery scheme.
Devoe was convicted in the shooting deaths of a 15-year-old girl and a 17-year-old girl. He also is accused of killing the 15-year-old's mother and the mother's boyfriend.
Druery was convicted in the shooting death of a 20-year-old man.
Earvin was convicted in the robbery and slaying of a 75-year-old Lufkin service station attendant.
Edwards was convicted in a fatal shooting and robbery at a Subway.
Eldrige was convicted in the shooting deaths of Cynthia Bogany and her 9-year-old daughter.
Escobar was convicted in the sexual assault and stabbing death of a 17-year-old girl.

Fuller was convicted in the shooting deaths of two of his neighbors after breaking into their home.

Gamboa was convicted in the fatal shooting of a 72-year-old man and a 54-year-old man while burglarizing a business.
Garcia and five co-defendants were convicted in the shooting death of a police officer in Irving while on escape from the TDCJ Connally Unit.
Gardner was convicted in the shooting death of a 41-year-old woman whose home he was attempting to burglarize.
Garza was convicted of shooting six men during a robbery. Ten other defendants faced similar charges.
Garza was convicted in the choking death of a 26-year-old man during a robbery.
Gates was convicted in the strangling and smothering death of a 41-year-old female.
Gobert was convicted in the stabbing death of a woman and attempted murder of her 5-year-old son.
Gomez was convicted in the fatal shooting of an 18-year-old male and two 16-year-old males.
Gonzales was convicted in the shooting death of an 18-year-old woman during the course of committing or attempting to commit aggravated sexual assault, kidnapping, or robbery.
Gonzales was convicted in the robbery and slaying of his elderly neighbors in Odessa.
Gonzalez was convicted in the shooting death of Bexar County Sheriff Sgt. Kenneth Vann. Vann was shot more than 25 times with an AR-15.

Granger was convicted in the shooting death of a bystander while he was retaliating against (and intending to kill) his daughter's mother for serving as a witness in a sexual assault case against him.
Green was convicted in the murders of his wife and her 6-year-old daughter in their home.
Green was convicted in the rape and murder of a 19-year-old female.
Griffin was convicted in the strangling death of a woman and the kidnapping of her son.

Gutierrez was convicted in the murder of a man he abducted from a convenience store parking lot.
Gutierrez was convicted in the fatal beating of an 85-year-old female in her home.

Hall was convicted in the strangling death of a woman.

Mason was convicted in the kidnapping and murder of his wife. He was granted a new punishment hearing and re-sentenced to death in November 2015.
Matthews was convicted in the shooting of a man who did not comply after Matthews demanded that he turn over his car keys.
Mays was convicted in the shooting death of Henderson County Deputy Sheriff Tony Ogborn. He was charged with the murder of a second deputy and attempted murder of a third.
McFarland was convicted in the robbery and murder of Kenneth Kwan, the 43-year-old owner of C&Y Grocery Store in Houston.
Medina was convicted in the shooting death of his two children, 3 and 8 months.

Mullis was convicted in the murder of his 3-month-old son.
Murphy was convicted in the shooting and drowning death and kidnapping of a 79-year-old woman.
